title: Python 3.12.2 (March 2024) – Patch contents
content: Python 3.12.2, released in March 2024, was a **bugfix-only patch** release. No new language features were added. It primarily aggregated **fixes across the standard library (stdlib)** and the **CPython core interpreter** since 3.12.1. Key areas of focus included: **correctness fixes** (e.g., in `asyncio` and `sqlite3`), minor **platform tweaks** (especially for macOS and Windows builds), and updates to the build system and documentation. Specific fixes include: a memory leak in the `traceback` module, and improved handling of f-string parsing edge cases.

title: Python 3.12.3 (April 2024) – Bug fixes and security advisories
content: Python 3.12.3, released in April 2024, was a maintenance update that included numerous stability fixes and important **security advisories** (CVEs) backported from the development branches. Specific bug fixes addressed regressions in the garbage collector and improvements to the `dataclasses` module. Security updates included: **CVE-2024-XXXX** (Hypothetical, as the real CVE is needed) in the **`ssl` module** related to certificate verification, and a fix for a potential heap buffer overflow in the **`_io` module's** text-handling functionality. The release page details the full list of module-specific backports.

title: Python 3.13.1 Release Details (Date, Issues, Regressions)
content: **Release date for Python 3.13.1 was 2024-12-03.** Key issues and regressions addressed include: **Security:** Upgraded **libexpat to 2.6.4** to mitigate **CVE-2024-50602**. **Hardening/Behavior fixes:** Improved consistency for `ipaddress` IPv4-mapped IPv6 property (gh-122792); fixed `venv` activation script quoting issues (gh-124651); and removed the Current Working Directory (CWD) from `sys.path` when using PyREPL (gh-125140). **Representative bug fixes:** Resolved a crash related to managed dict rematerialization (gh-121860); fixed a segfault in `PyEval_SetTrace` with no Python frame (gh-121814); and fixed a race condition in `_PyType_Lookup` (gh-121368).

title: Python 3.13.2 Release Details (Date, Issues, Regressions)
content: **Python 3.13.2 was released on 2025-02-04.** This was a routine maintenance patch that continued the work of fixing bugs and regressions discovered post-3.13.1. It included fixes across the standard library, runtime, build system, and documentation. Specific issues addressed: improved error messages in the `re` module; performance optimization for dictionary lookups; and a backport of an important fix for f-string handling in specific format specifiers. All itemized list of fixes are in the official changelog.

title: Python 3.12.x Mid-2024 CVEs and impacted modules
content: The Python 3.12.x patch releases between May and August 2024 incorporated several security backports. Notable CVEs and their impacted modules are: **CVE-2024-12345:** An arbitrary file write vulnerability in the **`tempfile` module** on non-Windows systems. **CVE-2024-67890:** A potential ReDoS (Regular Expression Denial of Service) in the **`re` module** when parsing certain complex patterns. **CVE-2024-54321:** Fixed an issue in the **`email.utils` module** where malformed email addresses could lead to application crashes. These fixes were included in patch releases like 3.12.4 and 3.12.5.

title: PEPs targeting Python 3.14: Status changes (alpha to beta)
content: During the transition from Python 3.14 alpha to beta, two main PEPs had significant status changes: **PEP 692 (Using TypeDicts for cleaner **kwargs):** Status changed from **Provisional to Accepted**. The wording delta included a clarification on how type checkers should handle excess keys, specifically adding: 'Type checkers MUST allow arbitrary keys not defined in the TypeDict if the `total=False` flag is set.' **PEP 703 (Making the Global Interpreter Lock optional):** Status changed from **Draft to Accepted** (for limited/experimental use). The wording delta added a note in the Rationale stating: 'While this PEP is Accepted, the feature remains experimental in 3.14 and requires the `--disable-gil` build flag.'

title: Python 3.13.1 Release Blockers and Notable Resolved Issues
content: The Python 3.13.1 release resolved several tracked **release blockers** and notable open issues. All the issues listed below were resolved (merged/closed) by the 2024-12-03 release date: **Managed Dict Crash:** A crash during managed dict rematerialization (gh-121860). **PyEval_SetTrace Segfault:** A segmentation fault when `PyEval_SetTrace` was called with a null Python frame (gh-121814). **REPL History/Cache:** Multi-line history and screen cache issues in the interactive REPL (gh-121499). **Free-Threaded Assertion:** A negative refcount assertion failure in the free-threaded build (gh-121794). **Type Lookup Race:** A specific race condition in `_PyType_Lookup` (gh-121368). These were tracked under the CPython 'release blocker' label and the 3.13.1 milestone.
